intro: Pagameopsis garryoides, commonly known as the Garry’s pagamea, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and maritime climates. It is known for its ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
